title.narrative: Conservation of 13th- and 14th-Century Saxon Fortified Churches in Transylvania

description.narrative: During the Middle Ages, the Transylvanian Saxons built fortified churches to provide refuge for villagers in the event of an attack. This project involves the conservation and adaptive reuse of two fortified churches.

title.narrative: Conservation of Monumental Funerary Stones in the Jewish Cemetery in Alba Iulia

description.narrative: Established in the 16th century, Alba Iulias Jewish community played a vital role in the towns civic and commercial life through the 1930s. This project involves the conservation of 80-100 monumental funerary stones (matzevas) in the cemetery and the interpretation of Jewish life and Jewish contributions in Alba Iulia and Transylvania.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of State: Nonproliferation Assistance Programs - Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund

description.narrative: Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund - Unspecified Enforcement/Interdiction: National Security Interest; The Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund (NDF) provides a means for the USG to respond rapidly to high priority nonproliferation and disarmament opportunities, circumstances, or conditions that are unanticipated or unusually difficult. NDF projects aim to destroy, secure, or prevent the proliferation of WMD, WMD-related materials and delivery systems, and destabilizing conventional weapons.

title.narrative: Adaptive Reuse of the Former Hinech Neorim Orthodox Synagogue in Oradea

description.narrative: To support the adaptation of the former Hinech Neorim Orthodox Synagogue in Oradea for reuse as a Jewish heritage museum. Built in the early 20th century, the former synagogue is one of the few remaining in Oradea, once the home to a flourishing Jewish community. The project involves the restoration of the building facades, roof, and interior.

title.narrative: Conservation of the 19th-Century Elie Wiesel Memorial House in Sighetu Marmatiei

description.narrative: The Elie Wiesel Memorial House preserves the birthplace and interprets the life and contributions of the Romanian-born American writer, Nobel laureate, activist, and Holocaust survivor. This project involves conservation intervention on the exterior and interior of the house to reverse deterioration.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Educational and Cultural Exchange Programs,

title.narrative: Strengthening Proactive Criminal Justice Response to TIP

description.narrative: To support the Romanian criminal justice system and other actors to address cases of TIP in a victim-centered, multi-disciplinary manner, by the following: 1)Strengthening the capacity of CJS actors to employ victim-sensitive, multi-disciplinary techniques to identify, investigate and prosecute cases of TIP; 2) Developing government champions and key influencers who will strengthen policies for victim protection and compensation and will support funding for the national strategy/action plans; and 3) Strengthening the quality of essential social services through increasing coordination between key frontline service providers and improving trauma-informed approaches to service provision.

title.narrative: Conservation of the 14th-Century Fortified Saxon Church in Alma Vii

description.narrative: The fortified church in the village of Alma Vii, with its characteristic defensive enclosure and raised choir, is an exceptional example of a building type associated with the ethnic German Saxons who had settled in southern Transylvania beginning in the mid-12th century. This project involves the conservation of the single-nave church exterior and roof.
